message.content:
cs.NE, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY 

The paper discusses the use of information-theoretic measures to infer causality in neuronal circuits for cognitive processing. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of directed information, which is a topic that falls under the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the limitations of these measures, which suggests that it may fall under the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) or Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of understanding fundamental logic processes in nervous systems, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY).
